official_title: A bill to amend title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to prohibit employment discrimination within the legislative branch of the government on the basis of an individual's race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

summary.text: Congressional Equal Employment Opportunity Act - Amends title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (Equal Employment Opportunity) to extend the prohibition against discrimination to employees of Congress. Stipulates that the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission shall have no authority to consider employment practice charges by such employees. Permits a legislative employee who has cause to believe that discrimination has occurred to file an action in any appropriate Federal district court. Authorizes the court, upon a finding that the respondent has engaged in an intentional unlawful employment practice, to require that the complainant be hired for an appropriate type of position (but not specific position) in the legislative branch.
